comments:
Workbench User Guide / Basic tutorial / Working with other editors
/ Embedded editors

does not work in M5 as advertised on my PC with NT 4.0, Service Pack 6.
Creation of the file JanesWordDoc.doc causes Eclipse to crash and also
prevents Eclipse from successfully running again even after a reboot.
Eclipse exits with no feedback moments after any attempt to start the IDE.
The only solution seems to be deletion of the workspace directory and
reinstallation of Eclipse.  Even then I had some problems.  Eclipse
seems to be saving some state information somewhere outside the
installation and workspace directories in spite of documentation
to the contrary.

The original error message was as follows:

"An internal error has occurred.
Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)
See error log for more details."

I could not find a log file, but the first stack trace below
corresponds to the error message above.  Dismissal of the error
dialog box above led to a Windows error dialog box with the
message "Unable to create part: JanesWord.doc"

Dismissal of the second dialog box led to a third dialog box with the
following message:

"An internal error has occurred
See error log for more details."

I could not find a log file but the second stack trace below corresponds to
the third error message.

Here's the stack trace for the first message:

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 13198 ***
